thread.title: Admit it: This Indiana bakery’s Tom Brady cookies are pretty funny - Patriots
thread.title_full: Admit it: This Indiana bakery’s Tom Brady cookies are pretty funny - Patriots

author: boston.com
title: Admit it: This Indiana bakery’s Tom Brady cookies are pretty funny - Patriots
text:
Colts fans aren’t passing up on a sweet chance to troll the Patriots about Deflategate ahead of Sunday’s game.
Taylor’s Bakery, one of the oldest in the state, is feeding Colts fans’ appetite for a win with cookies and cakes that reference the scandal. Sunday’s game will be the first time the two teams play one another since last year’s AFC Championship, where the Colts raised concerns about the air pressure in the Patriots’ footballs and launched the investigation that became Deflategate.
They’re selling some Tom Brady “monster” cookies with his infamous Deflategate court room sketch, which they printed up in bulk.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Tom Brady "monster" cookies now available! #ColtsNation pic.twitter.com/nWTUIDf2Bz
— Taylor's Bakery (@TaylorsBakery) October 16, 2015 They’ve also made a Deflate-cake, a chocolate frosted football-shaped cake with a squashed top.
#DeflateCakes will be on sale Friday 10/16/15 for $15. #ColtsNation make sure to get one before the big #Colts game! pic.twitter.com/3fWQsN5fwk
— Taylor's Bakery (@TaylorsBakery) October 15, 2015 And of course, some cookies in the shape of shattered smartphones .
What does #coltsnation think about 'Broken Cell Phone' cookies? #colts #NEvsIND pic.twitter.com/XnBOq37FJ0
— Taylor's Bakery (@TaylorsBakery) October 16, 2015 While some Patriots fans took to the bakery’s Facebook to shame their efforts, others, like this fan sporting a Rob Gronkowski jersey, stopped by for a taste of Brady.
Well, well, well... Look who is buying our cookies! #colts @espn @indystar #GoHorse ! #ColtsNation pic.twitter.com/GaKQ34bFTE
— Taylor's Bakery (@TaylorsBakery) October 16, 2015
